ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5-8 hours every week including readings and class time.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It's well delivered and I like the part of discussion on the real study design. We can thus learn how to put class knowledge into practical work.
This was an excellent course where I really learned a lot. The instructor was great, and I found the course very helpful and informative.
Good information and useful methodologies
It was good. Could use a little more interactive dialogue amongst students and teacher.
very interesting class
The lectures were very interesting but could have benefited from more discussion.
Very good. Helpful for learning methodology.
Very interesting subject matter. The course covered a lot of issues.

I very much enjoyed this course--it gave me a great introduction to environmental endocrine disruptors, as well as further training in the epidemiology that is required to design and analyze studies to investigate these chemicals that require much more research.

I enjoyed this course and I really enjoyed the content. I think the topic is really important and many people outside of EHS took the class because of this. Dr. Zhang is very knowledgeable and provided a wide range of topics for the class. I really enjoyed her choice of assignments for the midterm and final as they are good preparation for future manuscript and grand submissions.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yawei Zhang  She is positive, professional and clearly communicates what she expects.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawei is very responsible to students and she is a good lecturer too.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  She did an excellent job. She was well organized, and did a great job getting her concepts across.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Zhang knows the material well, but could use more liveliness in lectures
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Very accessible, knowledgeable and friendly. Some of the best pp slides I have seen. The tofu lecture and the floating babies were great.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Dr. Zhang was a great lecturer and was always well prepared and ready for questions and suggestions. She was also very approachable for extra help.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Very helpful.
Instructor: Yawei Zhang  A good instructor and well-versed in the subject.

Instructor: Yawei Zhang  Yawei is great--she is clearly very knowledgeable, but also funny, caring and attentive to her students and extremely responsive. She conveyed the information in a way that is approachable and never boring. I never got the feeling that she was just going through the motions--always alert and with the students best interests in mind.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a good course for the students who want to gain knowledge on environment and hormone issues, or who like to learn how to apply the epidemiology theories and methods.
This was an excellent course where I really learned a lot, even though it did not require much work outside of class. The instructor is great, and it is a great choice.
Useful information and much to pick up
Unfortunately, this class is a little redundant. It is very similar to the other EHS elective courses. It is hard to recommend it over another course.
Very interesting class, she puts a few too many article up for the weeely reading, but not all need to be done
Valuable and helpful.
Interesting subject, I'd recommend the course.

This course will give you an overview of environmental endocrine disruptors--you will learn primarily through lectures, critiquing research designs/methods and designing your own research study. I recommend this class.
